items.sentence: Tom is a good negotiator, so we should get him to negotiate for us.
Tom is very young, so he doesn't really understand what's going on.
Have you ever seen what happens if you mix vinegar and baking soda?
Go to the bookstore and buy a couple of books to read on your trip.
Tom sent an email to Mary asking her why she had changed her plans.
Which wire do you think I should cut, the red one or the green one?
The dogs eventually lost the scent and we had to give up the chase.
You seem to have made considerable progress since our last meeting.
I think that Tom bought the house that he was looking at last week.
It's not about whether you win or lose, it's how you play the game.
